channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Work with giant, caged robots, and Perl; Senior Developer, West London
item.description: Let's start off talking about the robots. They live in cages, they travel at 60mph, and they're controlled via AMQ messages from a Perl-based Warehouse Management System. Simultaneously awesome and terrifying, they work tirelessly to move expensive dresses around such exotic locations as Charlton, and Mahwah, New Jersey

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work? Trapped in a company with long release cycles and dubious release dates? Wish your ideas for product improvement didn't keep disappearing in to the Project Manager's backlog?

item.title: London-based Perl developer? Free Â£10,000 payrise (individual results may vary...)
item.description: Since the New Year, the majority of Perl employers in London decided they were voraciously hiring. At the same time, apparently, most Perl developers decided to scuttle â€” hermit-crab-like â€” away from the active job market.

item.title: The Perl Conference - US
item.description: Registration is now open for the US Perl Conference (formerly YAPC::NA)!

item.title: The Perl Conference - Amsterdam
item.description: Formerly YAPC::EU, the conference's theme this year is 'High-end Perl'. Call for Presentations remains open until June 15!

item.title: Perl Toolchain Summit
item.description: Formerly known as the Perl QA Hackathon, this year's Toolchain Summit will be held May 11-14 in Lyon, France.

item.title: French Perl Workshop
item.description: The French Perl Workshop will be held in Paris Jun 9-10.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: All things being equal, not all things are eqv
item.description: Perl 6 has a wealth of comparison operators! brian d foy gives us a rundown, and an admonishment about making rash assumptions.

item.title: You won't believe this one quick Perl 6 optimization hack!
item.description: Jeff clickbaits us, then shows a quick hack that speeds things up in the Perl6::Parser test suite.

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: April 4-10
Virtual Spring Cleaning Interlude: A herd of yaks, all waiting to be shaved
item.description: Max takes a swing at a couple of slow-burning projects.

item.title: Timeouts for Parallel::ForkManager
item.description: Doug hacks a bit to prevent hung tests by implementing a timeout on the ForkManager.

item.title: #299 - She's back!
item.description:
Happy Monday!

After some time off to get married, I'm back at it this week, and trying to get back into the swing of things. I could carry on at some length about my amazing husband (those of you who know me on Facebook have no-doubt gotten sick of it by now), but I sha'nt. Instead, on to the week's news!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
